meanings.definition: Work, especially sewing, done carelessly or hastily.
meanings.sent1: She handed in her slopwork, full of loose threads and crooked seams.
meanings.sent2: The tailor refused to accept the slopwork, knowing it would fall apart.
meanings.sent3: The slopwork was so messy, it looked like a cat had tried to sew.
meanings.sent4: Her slopwork was a patchwork of mistakes, like a quilt made by a beginner.
meanings.sent5: The slopwork was a disaster, like a painting done by a blindfolded artist.

meanings.definition: To do work, especially sewing, carelessly or hastily.
meanings.sent1: She would often slopwork her assignments the night before they were due.
meanings.sent2: He slopworks through his chores, leaving a trail of unfinished tasks.
meanings.sent3: Trying to slopwork through the project only led to more mistakes.
meanings.sent4: The chef had to slopwork the dish together when he realized he was missing an ingredient.
meanings.sent5: She slopworked her way through the maze of paperwork, hoping no one would notice the errors.
